episode_summary: This episode features facts about a Paralympic equestrian with a horse allergy, a man who changed his name to protest against a bank, the mystery of female whale sharks' habitats, and a historical site in Jerusalem becoming a zipline attraction. The hosts are joined by guest Rosie Jones, who shares her experiences with the Paralympics and discusses various quirky topics related to Yorkshire.

facts.fact: The world's greatest Paralympic equestrian, with 14 gold medals under his belt, is also allergic to horses.
A man from Yorkshire once changed his name by deed poll to Yorkshire Bank PLC Are Fascist Bastards.
Despite them being one of the largest fish on the planet, nobody knows where female whale sharks live.
The place where Judas plotted to betray Jesus is about to become a ziplining site.
